questions.question: Which reagent is used to fuse with the organic compound in Lassaigne's test?

explanations.b: In Lassaigne’s test, sodium is fused with the organic compound to convert elements like nitrogen, sulfur, and halogens into ionic forms (NaCN, Na₂S, NaX) which are water-soluble and can be detected.

questions.question: 2. What is formed when nitrogen is present in an organic compound and it is fused with sodium?

explanations.b: Nitrogen in the organic compound reacts with sodium to form NaCN, which is then detected using the Prussian blue test.
